about.summary: Spatial analyses involving binning require that every bin have the same area, but this is impossible using a rectangular grid laid over the Earth or over any projection of the Earth. Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in plotting such data.

Spatial analyses involving binning require that every bin have the same area, but this is impossible using a rectangular grid laid over the Earth or over any projection of the Earth. Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in plotting such data.

name: r-dggridr

about.summary: Spatial analyses involving binning require that every bin have the same area, but this is impossible using a rectangular grid laid over the Earth or over any projection of the Earth. Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in plotting such data.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2.0.4' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-dggridr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url: {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/dggridR/dggridR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 83a9f2ea7c9b4152baa6f47da72b72d73835ed45e62b71bcf6deccebc63cc086

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.12
    - r-dplyr >=0.4
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.1
    - r-rgdal >=1.1
    - r-sp >=1.2
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.12
    - r-dplyr >=0.4
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.1
    - r-rgdal >=1.1
    - r-sp >=1.2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('dggridR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('dggridR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/r-barnes/dggridR/
  license: MIT
  summary: Spatial analyses involving binning require that every bin have the same area, but
    this is impossible using a rectangular grid laid over the Earth or over any projection
    of the Earth. Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome
    this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides
    utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in
    plotting such data.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - marie59

# Description: Spatial analyses involving binning require that every bin have the same area, but this is impossible using a rectangular grid laid over the Earth or over any projection of the Earth. Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in plotting such data.

Discrete global grids use hexagons, triangles, and diamonds to overcome this issue, overlaying the Earth with equally-sized bins. This package provides utilities for working with discrete global grids, along with utilities to aid in plotting such data.
